title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0001
text: What does the 'Multiple Service Instances per Host' deployment pattern describe?

options.text: Running multiple service instances on a single physical or virtual host
Running one service instance per host
Running services on separate physical machines

explanation: The pattern describes deploying multiple service instances on a single host to optimize resource usage.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0002
text: Which of the following is a key advantage of running multiple service instances per host?
explanation: Running multiple instances per host improves resource utilization by sharing CPU and memory.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0003
text: Which of the following is a potential drawback of this pattern?
explanation: Multiple instances on one host can compete for CPU, memory, and I/O resources.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0004
text: Which deployment technology commonly supports this pattern?
explanation: Containerization platforms like Docker allow multiple isolated service instances to run on one host.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0005
text: What is a common risk when running multiple service instances per host?
explanation: If one instance consumes too many resources, it can degrade performance for others on the same host.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a benefit of this pattern for cost efficiency?
explanation: Running multiple instances per host maximizes hardware utilization, reducing infrastructure costs.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a challenge in this deployment model?

options.text: Ensuring fair resource allocation among instances

explanation: Fair resource allocation is challenging when multiple instances share the same host resources.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0008
text: Which of the following tools can help manage multiple service instances per host?
explanation: Kubernetes orchestrates multiple service instances across hosts efficiently.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a benefit of using containers for this pattern?
explanation: Containers provide lightweight isolation, allowing multiple instances to coexist efficiently.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of this pattern for fault isolation?

options.text: A host failure affects all instances on it

explanation: If the host fails, all service instances running on it are affected, reducing fault isolation.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a common monitoring challenge in this pattern?
explanation: Monitoring resource usage per instance is complex when multiple instances share a host.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a benefit of this pattern for deployment speed?

options.text: Faster startup times due to shared host resources

explanation: Shared host resources allow faster startup and deployment of multiple service instances.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a common use case for this pattern?

options.text: Running multiple lightweight microservices on a single server
Running one monolithic application per host

explanation: This pattern is ideal for running multiple lightweight microservices on a single host.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of this pattern for security?
explanation: If isolation is weak, one compromised instance could affect others on the same host.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a benefit of this pattern for scaling?

options.text: Allows horizontal scaling by adding more instances per host

explanation: Multiple instances per host allow horizontal scaling by adding more instances as needed.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentMultipleServiceInstancesPerHost - Q0016

explanation: The pattern focuses on deploying multiple isolated service instances on a single host to optimize resource usage.
